name: Sweet and Sour Tofu
description: Perfect fried tofu, pineapple, and vegetables are tossed together in a homemade sweet and sour sauce to make this Sweet and Sour Tofu! Itâ€™s ready in about 30 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 1 tablespoon soy sauce (tamari for gluten free)
1 cup fresh pineapple chunks (or canned if needed)
1  red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks
1  green bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks
1/2 large yellow onion, cut into 1-inch chunks
few more tablespoons olive oil, for frying
sesame seeds and green onions, for serving

itemListElement.text: In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, ketchup, apple cider vinegar, soy sauce, minced garlic and cornstarch. Set aside.
itemListElement.name: In a small bowl, whisk together the sugar, ketchup, apple cider vinegar, soy sauce, minced garlic and cornstarch. Set aside.

itemListElement.text: Press the tofu: Press the tofu by wrapping it in paper towels (or a clean dry tea towel). Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books or cast iron pan on top of that. Let the tofu press for 30 minutes to an hour. I like to press a few blocks at a time on the weekend, then keep in the refrigerator for quick weeknight meals.
itemListElement.name: Press the tofu: Press the tofu by wrapping it in paper towels (or a clean dry tea towel). Place a plate or pan on top of the wrapped tofu, and put a couple of heavy books or cast iron pan on top of that. Let the tofu press for 30 minutes to an hour. I like to press a few blocks at a time on the weekend, then keep in the refrigerator for quick weeknight meals.

itemListElement.text: Cut the pressed tofu into 1 inch cubes and add to a large bowl. Drizzle the soy sauce on top and stir gently with a silicone spatula or small spoon. Be careful not to rip the tofu.
itemListElement.name: Cut the pressed tofu into 1 inch cubes and add to a large bowl. Drizzle the soy sauce on top and stir gently with a silicone spatula or small spoon. Be careful not to rip the tofu.

itemListElement.text: Now sprinkle on the cornstarch and gently stir to coat the tofu.
itemListElement.name: Now sprinkle on the cornstarch and gently stir to coat the tofu.

itemListElement.text: Heat a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil so it coats the pan.
itemListElement.name: Heat a large non-stick pan over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil so it coats the pan.

itemListElement.text: Once the oil is hot, add the tofu in a single layer (you might need to do this in batches, depending on how big your pan is). Let the tofu brown on all sides, it should be a nice golden color all over. Transfer to a plate nearby.
itemListElement.name: Once the oil is hot, add the tofu in a single layer (you might need to do this in batches, depending on how big your pan is). Let the tofu brown on all sides, it should be a nice golden color all over. Transfer to a plate nearby.

itemListElement.text: Add another tablespoon of oil to the pan, if needed. Add the pineapple, bell peppers and onion and cook for about 2 minutes until crisp-tender.
itemListElement.name: Add another tablespoon of oil to the pan, if needed. Add the pineapple, bell peppers and onion and cook for about 2 minutes until crisp-tender.

itemListElement.text: Whisk the sauce one more time before adding it to the pan and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly as it thickens. Now add the fried tofu back to the pan and stir, cooking for about 5 minutes until the sauce thickens a bit.
itemListElement.name: Whisk the sauce one more time before adding it to the pan and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly as it thickens. Now add the fried tofu back to the pan and stir, cooking for about 5 minutes until the sauce thickens a bit.

itemListElement.text: Serve immediately with cooked rice and green onions or sesame seeds. Enjoy!
